entries.title: I’ve reviewed laptops for decades; and this $499 Core i7 2-in1 laptop is perfect for freelancers
entries.description: A Walmart-exclusive deal, this Gateway laptop comes with plenty of bells and whistles that make it an appealing purchase.

entries.title: Many security teams are prioritizing prevention over detection, with disastrous results
entries.description: Hackers are running rampant in corporate networks, while businesses focus on preventing entry.

entries.title: Sony’s new AV receivers with PS5 & Sonos support are the future-proof option we need
entries.description: After a five year hiatus, Sony has launched a range of fully decked out receivers, and the results look – and sound – worth the wait.

entries.title: YouTube's Go Live Together lets you co-host a livestream – but there's a catch
entries.description: Currently rolling out to iOS and Android, the feature is restricted to channels that at least have 50 subscribers.

entries.title: Cisco fixes security flaw that could have allowed sneaky hacking
entries.description: A fix for the Cisco IOx is already available, so patch now.

entries.title: Microsoft Visual Studio add-ins could be used to deliver malware
entries.description: A somewhat niche method is growing more popular in the cybercrime community following the demise of the macro.

entries.title: China's first practical quantum computer has been around for a year
entries.description: Chinese state media lifts the lid on the Origin Wuyuan, but only partially.

entries.title: Samsung's stunning The Frame TV drops to a record-low price ahead of Super Bowl
entries.description: Samsung's Super Bowl TV deals include the stunning 65-inch The Frame TV on sale for a record-low price of $1,599.99.

entries.title: The horses in Dragon Age were lying to you
entries.description: The creative director for Dragon Age revealed a useless fact and hilarious lie recently on Twitter.

entries.title: Tim Cook says Apple Pay Later will still launch - just not yet
entries.description: Tim Cook confirms plans for Apple Pay Later launch are still afoot.

entries.title: Your Android smartphone could be getting a popular iOS 16 camera feature
entries.description: Google is apparently developing an Android feature called DeviceAsWebcam, which sounds a lot like iOS 16's Continuity Camera.

entries.title: Google and VMware are finally working together in the cloud
entries.description: Whether you’re a business operator or a personal user, chances are you may be able to use more services with Google soon.

entries.title: 7 new movies and TV shows on Netflix, Prime Video, HBO Max and more this weekend (February 3)
entries.description: From new Apple TV Plus dramas to returning comedy series, there’s plenty to watch this weekend.

entries.title: ION Group ransomware attack affects trading across the world
entries.description: The LockBit attack forced major companies to switch to manual trade processing, causing significant delays

entries.title: The HomePod 2 hits stores today, but it's strictly for hardcore Apple fans
entries.description: The HomePod 2 is now available to buy from Apple stores, but only those who are all-in on Apple should consider it.

entries.title: Tiny11 is out, promising to be Windows 11 without steep hardware requirements
entries.description: Here’s a Windows 11 version your PC can run (very probably), but there are serious caveats here.

entries.title: Samsung 990 Pro SSDs may have some serious capacity issues
entries.description: Samsung’s prized NVMe SSD is losing ‘health’ and capacity at an alarming rate, and it’s not an isolated problem.

entries.title: Don't worry, your legacy G Suite account still isn’t moving to Google Workspace
entries.description: Despite notice messages to the contrary, Google claims it’s committed to keeping G Suite, a set of free collaboration tools for grandfathered users, intact.

entries.title: Google is ready to take on ChatGPT – and we’ll see its AI masterplan any day now
entries.description: Google says its ChatGPT rival will arrive soon – and has announced an AI-themed event next week.

entries.title: The Vivo X90 Pro is going global to challenge the Samsung Galaxy S23
entries.description: The Vivo X90 Pro has a 1-inch camera and flagship power, and it's coming soon to the UK.

entries.title: Meta sues the company it pays to scrape data for...scraping data
entries.description: Tech giant is involved in a legal battle with Bright Data, a company it has asked to scrape other websites in the past.

entries.title: Don’t expect Apple’s AirPods Max 2 headphones to launch in 2023
entries.description: The Apple AirPods Max 2 headphones are still a few years away, according to a top Apple analyst.

entries.title: The first leaked Sony Xperia 1 V image shows camera upgrades and downgrades
entries.description: The Sony Xperia 1 V might have new cameras and an extra mic, but could lose some sensors.

entries.title: Windows 10 popup bug is blocking people from accessing their desktops
entries.description: Warning: Be very careful of Microsoft 365 trial offers when first booting up Windows 10.

entries.title: Microsoft Viva is giving your sales a ChatGPT boost
entries.description: Microsoft Viva adds AI and ChatGPT for an extra sales boost.

entries.title: Intel’s Arc A750 GPU just got a price cut - and AMD should be worried
entries.description: A few driver updates later, the Arc A750 is a solid choice of budget GPU - and this move makes it even more attractive.

entries.title: This Google Ads campaign pushes malware that your antivirus can't pick up
entries.description: Fake Google Ads campaign promoting popular 3D rendering software is actually deploying dangerous infostealers.
